snippet: A reporter with the presence of a performer, Mr. Wallace went head-to-head with chiefs of state, celebrities and con artists for more than 50 years.
abstract: Mike Wallace, the CBS reporter who became one of America’s best-known broadcast journalists as an interrogator of the famous and infamous on 60 Minutes, dies at age 93; he went head to head with chiefs of state, celebrities and con artists for more than 50 years, and his success often lay in the questions he hurled, not the answers he received.
lead_paragraph: A reporter with the presence of a performer, Mr. Wallace went head-to-head with chiefs of state, celebrities and con artists for more than 50 years.

headline.seo: Mike Wallace, CBS Pioneer of ‘60 Minutes,’ Dead at 93
headline.main: Mike Wallace, CBS Pioneer of ‘60 Minutes,’ Dies at 93
headline.print_headline: Fierce ‘60 Minutes’ Interrogator Who Didn’t Blink
